item.title: loren add a quote by walt whitman
item.description: "All goes onward and outward, nothing collapses, And to die is different from what any one supposed, and luckier." -- walt whitman

item.title: loren add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I must learn to be content with being happier than I deserve." -- Jane Austen

item.title: loren add a quote by Douglas McGrath
item.description: "Perhaps it is our imperfections that make us so perfect for one another!" -- Douglas McGrath

item.title: loren add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: loren add a quote by Dodie Smith
item.description: "Perhaps if I make myself write I shall find out what is wrong with me." -- Dodie Smith

item.title: loren add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Heterosexuality is not normal, it's just common." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: loren add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I hate writing, I love having written." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: loren add a quote by Ed Begley Jr.
item.description: "I don’t understand why when we destroy something created by man we call it vandalism, but when we destroy something by nature we call it progress." -- Ed Begley Jr.

item.title: loren add a quote by J. Krishnamurti
item.description: "It is no measure of health to be well adjusted to a profoundly sick society." -- J. Krishnamurti

item.title: loren add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: loren add a quote by Natalie Goldberg
item.description: "Write what disturbs you, what you fear, what you have not been willing to speak about. Be willing to be split open." -- Natalie Goldberg

item.title: loren add a quote by Natalie Goldberg
loren add a quote by Natalie Goldberg
item.description: "If you are not afraid of the voices inside you, you will not fear the critics outside you." -- Natalie Goldberg

item.title: loren add a quote by Natalie Goldberg
item.description: "We are important and our lives are important, magnificent really, and their details are worthy to be recorded. This is how writers must think, this is how we must sit down with pen in hand. We were here; we are human beings; this is how we lived. Let it be known, the earth passed before us. Our details are important. Otherwise, if they are not, we can drop a bomb and it doesn't matter. . . Recording the details of our lives is a stance against bombs with their mass ability to kill, against too much speed and efficiency. A writer must say yes to life, to all of life: the water glasses, the Kemp's half-and-half, the ketchup on the counter. It is not a writer's task to say, "It is dumb to live in a small town or to eat in a café when you can eat macrobiotic at home." Our task is to say a holy yes to the real things of our life as they exist – the real truth of who we are: several pounds overweight, the gray, cold street outside, the Christmas tinsel in the showcase, the Jewish writer in the orange booth across from her blond friend who has black children. We must become writers who accept things as they are, come to love the details, and step forward with a yes on our lips so there can be no more noes in the world, noes that invalidate life and stop these details from continuing." -- Natalie Goldberg

item.title: loren add a quote by bell hooks
item.description: "Living simply makes loving simple." -- bell hooks

item.title: loren add a quote by bell hooks
item.description: "Love is an action, never simply a feeling." -- bell hooks
